intro: Silene colorata var. vulgaris, commonly known as the common campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species that typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm. The plant produces striking pink to red flowers with five petals, which bloom in clusters at the top of the stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Silene colorata var. vulgaris is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
